author: djrtwo
content:
Its a consensus-layer client

Colloquially this client has been composed of a BN and VC. It seemed useful to use those distinctions in that explanation

author: djrtwo
content: Maybe I'll call it a CL and VC in subsequent explanations?

author: djrtwo
content:
a node is CL+EL

A node validators on it is (CL+EL)+VC

author: djrtwo
content: Or maybe a CL client is (BN+optional_VC+optional_remote_signer) and thus to be able to talk about specific sub components, BN is still valuable

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> wouldn't it be correct to consider the EL client as a subset of the consensus client? because a consensus client isn't complete without an execution client connected to it

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> So maybe it should be CL = (EL + BN)?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> We are regularly calling the separation of duties as CL or EL so I wouldn’t want to verbally combine those two. It has been useful to say “CL does this, then communicates that to EL, then etc etc”
